revised_title: Developmental Mechanics of Chick and Duck Embryos: In Vitro Cultivation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the development of chick and duck embryos by cultivating them in vitro, using a watch-glass technique. They found that this method can be applied to study the developmental mechanics of young fowl blastoderms and provided some results from their preliminary study. The technique allowed them to observe the formation of endoderm and mesoderm in birds, which differs from the process in amphibians.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
